doc.name: is within
doc.summary: Evaluates to true if a point is inside the specified rectangle, false if it is outside.

examples.example: the mouseLoc is within the rect of this stack

description.p: Use the is within operator to determine whether a point is inside a rectangle.
The point is any expression that evaluates to a point--a vertical and horizontal distance from the top left of the current stack, separated by a comma.
The rectangle is any expression that evaluates to a rectangle--a right, top, left, and bottom edge, separated by commas.

p.code: point is within the rect of object

description.p: unless the object is a graphic or image, or a tabbed button.
The is within operator is the logical inverse of the is not within operator. When one is true, the other is false.
